review_title: A great place to learn and grow with an amazing work culture
pros: As someone who has a lot of friends and family spread across the development sector I can say with a great deal of certitude that GBL has one of the best work cultures out there. Also doesn't hurt that they pay at or above market rates (in the Indian development sector).
cons: GBL has two offices in India, however most of the staff are remote and the leadership is partially based in the West, these factors combine to sometimes make the work day a little unexpected in duration. However, GBL's people ops team (fancy way of saying HR team) and the mangers themselves do a lot to alleviate any drawbacks flowing down from this issue.

review_title: workplace that offers enabling culture and fulfilment
pros: Working at GBL enables me to bring my whole self to work every day. The organization believes in a culture of care, well-being, transparency, collaboration, responsible work, and coaching by managers. We run sprints and marathons, take breaks and have fun at work! Monday mornings we look forward to connecting with our team and don't just ask "how did the weekend go?"; we genuinely LISTEN and SHARE.
cons: You might get a nudging from your manager to switch off from work while you are on a break and replying to slack messages😅
